content.description: Stand start with any combination of edges. From there, climb straight on edges to reach a solid topout.
content.protection: A pair of pads would be a good idea. The immediate fall zone is good, but there are several rocks surrounding the area.
content.location: It climbs the west face of Riorap.

content.description:
Solipsism climbs a featured vertical face/arete feature on solid stone over a good landing.

Stand start with a left hand on the arete and a right hand two-finger pocket. From there, make a series a bumps with the left hand up the arete while bumping the right hand up through a series of edges, at the lip, traverse right a few feet, and top it out.

A sit can be added for additional moves as well.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. The landing is good though.
content.location: It climbs the west side of Riorap's northwest arete.

content.description:
Brain Decay is a technical problem that ascends a vertical face by using a good assortment of holds.

Stand start with a left hand pocket and a small, right hand edge.  From there, execute a few easy moves on decent crimps until reaching a diagonal, right hand crimp.  At this point, either dyno to the lip (crux) or work a pinch-pocket and thin crimp (crux) to attain the lip, and top it out.
content.protection: A few pads should do it, and a spot wouldn't hurt either.  The landing is good, but there is large rock out right of the problem.
content.location: This ascends the center of Riorap's west face.
